infos.value: ...What is it? Are you weary?
It is still some way before we reach Hourne.
I knowww. It's just that...
We've been ordered back to Hourne Castle to check up on Lord Dario.
But now that I think about it, I don't know anything about him...
He's never left his chambers since as early as I can remember.
Ah, that's true.
Big Brother, do you know much about Lord Dario?
I often played with His Highness as a child.
Oh? What kind of person was he?
As average as it gets. Alas...
...Alas?
Lord Dario bears the clairvoyance to see his enemies' movements. But that is the least of his true powers.
...Wait, what do you mean!?
Let me put it this way. A small flame may offer comfort on a dark, cold night.
Yet the same flame can level forests with a ferocity far beyond our control.
Likewise, there cannot be life without water.
But a raging torrent will sweep away people and homes without hesitation.
So, what you're saying is that Lord Dario's magic is dangerous?
I suppose so. He himself knows that his powers are nigh uncontrollable.
He learned as much the hard way.
...The hard way?
Lord Dario and I loved heading out on what we used to call "adventures" of a sort.
Adventures? Where?
Right around here, actually.
W-wait, hold on... You came all the way out here when you were kids!?
Indeed we did.
Unbelievable...
Then the monsters came.
That day, another of Lord Dario's friends happened to be accompanying us.
That friend...
Not...the monsters...?
The attack sent Lord Dario into a state of panic.
To save his friend, he threw whatever magic he could at the monsters.
The magic that...you said he can't control?
He unleashed it in an instant. By the time the dust settled, both the monsters and his friend were...
I suppose you can guess the rest of the story.
So, that friend...
Lord Dario feared his magic from that day onward, and he has since resigned himself to his quarters.
...Let us keep going.
